result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Ext Code #2.
Bail jumping on underlying Waukesha County case 22CF326.
Bench Warrant was missing information about bail jumping charge - to be reissued.
Clerk's office was not able to mail this out to the defendant as we do not have a current mailing address. (am)

2:17 PM;  Defendant Davonte L Montriel not in court.  Attorney Jeffery Jensen, for attorney Eryn M Menden, in court for Davonte L Montriel.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Jensen advises he has no explanation for the defendant's non-appearance.  State requests a capias be issued and bail be revoked and/or forfeited.  Court will issue capias and orders bail be forfeited.

2:48 PM Defendant Davonte L Montriel in court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.  State has no objection to reinstating bail.  Court quashes the warrant and reinstates bail.  Court sets matter before the trial court for a status date.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
1:13 PM Defendant Davonte L Montriel not in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.  Warrant remains in effect.

addressed to: Davonte Montriel for hearing on 9/6/22

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Davonte L Montriel.  Atty. Menden advises she has not been able to reach her client and has no excuse for his non-appearance today. Ext Code #2.
Bail jumping on underlying Waukesha County case 22CF326.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

11:00 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Davonte L Montriel in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Menden advises the defendant still needs to waive the preliminary hearing, and notes he is prepared to do that today.  Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing. Atty. Menden acknowledges receipt of the information and waives reading.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Atty. Menden provides an update, she is requesting a plea and sentencing date in about 45 days.  No objection from the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:05 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Davonte L Montriel in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Menden advises the Court of the status of the cases and is requesting another further proceedings date. Court notes this matter still needs to proceed to preliminary hearing.  Atty. Menden requests the time limits be tolled and this matter continue to tag along with the defendant's other case for status.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
